know_more: She is singular so use DOESN'T not don't!
Cats is plural so use ARE not is!
Use HE for subject (doing action). HIM is for objects.
Past tense of see is SAW. Seen needs have/had before it.
They is plural so use WERE not was!
She/He/It needs an S on the verb! She RUNS.
ITS (no apostrophe) = belonging to it. IT'S = it is.
Everyone is singular! Use HAS not have.

text1: She speaks more louder than him.
know_more: Never use MORE with -ER words. Just LOUDER not more louder!

text1: Between you and I this is wrong.
know_more: Between you and ME. Object pronouns after prepositions!

text1: The team are playing good today.
know_more: WELL is the adverb. GOOD is an adjective. Playing WELL!

text1: If I was you I would leave now.
know_more: If I WERE you - subjunctive mood for hypotheticals!

text1: The number of students have increased.
know_more: The NUMBER (singular) HAS increased. Numbers HAVE...

text1: Whom is responsible for this mess?
know_more: WHO for subjects (doing action). WHOM for objects.

text1: She lay the book on the table.
know_more: LAY needs an object (lay something). Past tense is LAID.

text1: The boy run to school every day.
We was going to the park.
know_more: We is plural so use WERE not was!
Use SHE for subject. HER is for objects.
Always put the other person first! John and I.

text1: This is the most biggest house.
know_more: Never use MOST with -EST! Just BIGGEST.
SHE and I are friends. SHE for subjects!

text1: Neither of the boys are ready.
know_more: NEITHER is singular! Use IS not are.
DATA is plural! Use ARE. Datum is singular.
SHE and I went shopping. Subject pronouns!
